source_sentence: 佛本行集經卷第四
translation: Sutra on the Collection of the Past Activities of the Buddha, Volume 4

source_sentence: 隋天竺三藏闍那崛多譯
translation: Sui Tianzhu Tripiṭaka Jñānagupta Translation

source_sentence: 受決定記品下
translation: Second Chapter of the Acceptance of Certainty

source_sentence: 「爾時，然燈如來、多陀阿伽度、阿羅呵、三藐三佛陀，知於我心，與大比丘百千人俱，及彼天龍千萬億眾，左右圍繞來向我所，足蹈我身及螺髮上，安庠而行如大龍王，觀看左右告諸比丘：『汝等比丘！
translation: "At the time, the Tathāgata Randana, the Tathāgata Agastya, the Āraha, and the Samyak-saṃbuddha, knowing my mind, accompanied by a hundred thousand great monks and a thousand thousand million of those celestial dragons, came to me surrounded by right and left, stepped on my body and onto my conch hair, and walked calmly as a great dragon king, looked around and addressed the monks, saying, 'You monks!

source_sentence: 不得共我同路而行，是摩那婆身及螺髮，無有一人堪可蹈者。
translation: Not being able to walk with me on the same road, there's no one who can trample on the body and conch hair of a man like that.

source_sentence: 此人身髮，唯除如來，乃堪踐耳。
translation: Except for the Tathāgata, this person's hair is fit to be trodden on.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 此是菩薩身及髮分。』
translation: This is the bodhisattva's body and hair.'

source_sentence: 時然燈佛即語我言：『善哉善哉！
translation: Randana Buddha then said to me, 'Good, good!

source_sentence: 汝摩那婆！
translation: You, Manabha!

source_sentence: 發廣大心誓願如海，汝所求者，為諸眾生作利益故，為諸眾生作安樂故。
translation: Give rise to a vast vow, vowing like an ocean, that what you seek will be for the benefit of sentient beings and for the welfare of sentient beings.

source_sentence: 摩那婆！
translation: Manabha!

source_sentence: 汝既求此如是大願，利益安樂一切世間，憐愍無量無邊眾故，能為天人作引導故，發大精進勇猛之心。
translation: Since you seek to make this great vow to benefit and comfort all the world, have compassion for measureless and limitless multitudes, and be able to guide gods and humans, you muster great zeal and boldness.

source_sentence: 「『乃能滿足如是等法，志求金剛，不惜身命，是故汝今以身荷負如來而行。
translation: "'It's then that you're able to fulfill such a teaching, aspire to vajra, and spare no life, so now you'll bear the Tathāgata's burden in your body and carry it out.

source_sentence: 汝於當來，乃至不得慳惜身命，何況餘財？
translation: In the future, you won't even be able to spare your body and life, so why wouldn't you spare the rest of your possessions?'

source_sentence: 汝摩那婆！
translation: You, Manabha!

source_sentence: 求於阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，此是初相，汝能發起如是弘願，汝一切捨所有之物。
translation: This is the first aspect of seeking unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, and you can give rise to this great vow that you'll abandon all your possessions.

source_sentence: 汝摩那婆！
translation: Thou, Manabha!

source_sentence: 所行布施，不得求於未來世報，唯求出世無上菩提。
translation: When you practice generosity, you mustn't seek future worldly rewards but only supreme supreme enlightenment in the transmundane realm.

source_sentence: 勿生貪心，見他資財不得奪取，汝持禁戒勿令缺犯，不得穢濁，不應取相，勿自譽讚誹謗他人及毀自身。
translation: Don't become greedy; don't seize another's possessions when you see them, don't allow a breach of the precepts, don't defile them, don't get hold of appearances, and don't praise yourself, slander others, or disparage yourself.

source_sentence: 汝當忍辱，設有他來打罵禁繫殺害之者，皆須忍受，乃至節節支解於汝身體之時，汝於如是怨讎等邊，應當忍辱生慈悲心。
translation: You must tolerate humiliation, for if another person comes to scold, bind, or kill you, even when it's done to your body section by section, you must tolerate such enemies and produce a compassionate mind.

source_sentence: 不得殺生，不得劫奪他身命財，於他財物常遠捨離，於自營求亦當知足。
translation: Don't kill people, don't plunder other people's lives and property, and always avoid other people's property; you should also be satisfied with your own pursuits.

source_sentence: 莫近他人婦女妻妾，於自所有，亦須不貪。
translation: Don't go near another person's wife or concubine, and don't crave what you own.

source_sentence: 遠離妄語，乃至命盡，不得向他非實而說。
translation: He must avoid false speech, even to the point of his life ending, and mustn't tell others what's not true.

source_sentence: 不得鬪亂，親者令疎，見破壞人，恒教和合。
translation: They mustn't get into a fight, make their relatives go away, and always teach harmony when they see someone who is destructive.

source_sentence: 不得惡口，常以美言。
translation: He mustn't speak harshly, but always speak well.

source_sentence: 不得綺語，必有利益，時語法語。
translation: You mustn't speak fancy words that will surely be beneficial, and you must speak the Dharma at the right time.

source_sentence: 汝行正見，一切邪道皆當捨離。
translation: You must conduct yourself with right views, and all wrong paths will be abandoned.

source_sentence: 汝摩那婆！
translation: You, Manabha!

source_sentence: 若能荷擔如是諸事，汝所求願無不具足。
translation: If you can bear such a burden, none of your desires will be fulfilled.

source_sentence: 汝應於彼一切眾生，生一子想哀愍眾生，調伏心口，莫作諂曲，應當供養尊重之人，汝莫慠慢，令心放逸。
translation: Regarding all those sentient beings, you should give rise to the idea of the one child, pity for them, control your mind and mouth, refrain from flattery, and honor those who should be supported, so don't be arrogant and allow your mind to wander.

source_sentence: 常須寂定三昧正受，觀無我法，勿斷未來菩提種性。
translation: Always observe the correct feeling of tranquil concentration and samādhi, contemplate the absence of self, and don't cut off the seed nature of future enlightenment.

source_sentence: 汝當如是利益眾生，安樂一切。
translation: Thus you should benefit sentient beings and bring comfort to them all.

source_sentence: 摩那婆！
translation: Manabha!

source_sentence: 汝若能辦如是等事，口可自唱稱言我能。』
translation: If you can do such a thing, you can sing out with your own mouth and say, 'I can.'

source_sentence: 時我爾時，即白佛言：『世尊！
translation: At that point, I said to the Buddha, 'Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我能。』
translation: 'I can.'

source_sentence: 「時，然燈佛、多陀阿伽度、阿羅呵、三藐三佛陀，既知我心，即時微笑。
translation: "Then, Randana Buddha, Dharmagupta, Ālāha, and Samyak-saṃbuddha, knowing my mind, smiled immediately.

source_sentence: 彼佛有一侍者比丘，從座而起，整理衣服，偏袒右臂，長跪合掌白言：『世尊！
translation: One of their attendants got up from his seat, adjusted his robes, bared his right arm, knelt down with his palms together, and said, 'Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 以何因緣，如來微笑？』
translation: By what causes and conditions does the Tathāgata smile?'

source_sentence: 時然燈佛，告比丘言：『比丘！
translation: Then Rājagṛha addressed the monks, saying, 'Monks!

source_sentence: 汝見是摩那婆，持七莖花，供養於我，伏身被髮，泥上作橋，令我踐渡。
translation: "Do you see this manabha who makes offerings to me with seven flowers, submits himself to me with his hair down, and makes a bridge out of mud for me to cross?

source_sentence: 以是事故，此摩那婆，過於阿僧祇劫，當得作佛，號釋迦牟尼、多陀阿伽度、阿羅呵、三藐三佛陀，十號具足，如我無異。』
translation: Because of this, this manabha, after an incalculably long eon, will become a buddha and be called Śākyamuni, Dharmagupta, Ālāha, and Samyak-saṃbuddha, with all ten names, just like me.'

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 我於是時，聞然燈佛為我授於決定記已，身心輕便，不覺自騰於虛空中，高七多羅樹，以清淨心，合十指掌，向佛作禮。
translation: After I heard that Randana Buddha had given me the prediction of future Buddhahood, I felt relaxed in body and spirit and unconsciously lifted myself up into the sky, towering over seven palm trees, and saluted the Buddha with my ten fingers and palms together with a pure heart.

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 我於彼時，遍身喜悅，不能自勝。
translation: At the time, I was so overwhelmed with joy that I couldn't control myself.

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 時然燈佛即告我言：『摩那婆！
translation: Then Randana Buddha addressed me, saying, 'Manabha!

source_sentence: 汝可觀於東方世界。』
translation: You may contemplate the eastern world.'

source_sentence: 時，我即觀見彼東方恒河沙等剎土諸佛，皆悉為我授決定記：『汝摩那婆！
translation: I then looked at all the buddhas of the Ganges River Sands in the east and saw them all giving me a predetermined prediction: 'You Manabha!

source_sentence: 於未來世，過僧祇劫，當得作佛號釋迦牟尼十號具足。』
translation: In a future life, beyond incalculably long eons, he'll attain the full set of ten epithets for the Buddha called Śākyamuni.'

source_sentence: 如此東方，南西北方、四維上下，亦復如是。
translation: So it will be to the east, south, west, north, the four counterpoints, and up and down.

source_sentence: 「阿難！
translation: "Ānanda!

source_sentence: 我於爾時，從空而下，安立住地，頂禮然燈世尊佛足，却住一面，即生此念：『我今可於然燈佛邊求索出家。』
translation: At the time, I descended from the sky, stood at attention, bowed my head at the feet of the World Honored Randamāṇa Buddha, withdrew to one side, and had this thought, 'Now, I could seek renunciation at the side of the Randamāṇa Buddha.'

source_sentence: 即白佛言：『唯願世尊！
translation: I then said to the Buddha, 'May it be, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 聽我出家受具足戒，我於佛邊修行梵行。』
translation: After listening to me, I left home and received the full precepts, and I've been cultivating the religious practice at the Buddha's side.'

source_sentence: 佛語我言：『汝摩那婆！
translation: The Buddha said to me, 'You, Manabha!

source_sentence: 今正是時。』
translation: 'Now is the right time.'

source_sentence: 即得出家，剃除鬚髮；除鬚髮已，無量諸天，取於我髮，為供養故，十億諸天，共得一髮。
translation: I left home, shaved off my hair, and after I removed my hair, measureless gods took my hair and offered it up as an offering to a billion gods, who all had one hair.

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 自我得成阿耨多羅三藐三菩提已來，不見一眾生不供養諸佛而得安樂者，無有是處。
translation: Since I attained supreme perfect enlightenment, I haven't seen a single sentient being who attains well-being without making offerings to the buddhas.

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 我於彼時，猶尚具足諸煩惱縛，貪欲瞋恚愚癡未盡，無量百千億諸眾生，取於我髮，各持供養而得解脫；況復今日，離欲瞋癡，而於我邊，作諸功德，不得解脫，無有是處。
translation: At the time, I was still fully fettered by the afflictions, and my desire, anger, and ignorance hadn't ended, so measureless hundreds of millions of sentient beings took my hair, made offerings to each, and attained liberation; how could it be that today, free of desire and anger and ignorance, I'd make merits on my side that wouldn't lead to liberation, and there'd be no place for them?

source_sentence: 是故阿難！
translation: Therefore, Ānanda!

source_sentence: 一切眾生，應當發心供養如來。
translation: All sentient beings should arouse the intention to make offerings to the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 「阿難！
translation: "Ānanda!

source_sentence: 我從彼來，在煩惱中行菩薩行，不捨精進勇猛之心，常行布施，常作功德。
translation: Since then, I've practiced bodhisattva behavior in the midst of affliction, never abandoning the mental state of energy and fierceness, always making alms, and always producing merit.

source_sentence: 我以如是諸善業故，於彼無量百千世中，得作梵王、作於帝釋，或作百千轉輪聖王，以彼善根因緣力故，今得作佛、多陀阿伽度、阿羅呵、三藐三佛陀，得轉無上最妙法輪。
translation: Because of such good actions, I was able to become a Brahmā king, an emperor, or one of the hundred thousand wheel-turning sage kings in measureless hundreds of thousands of lifetimes, and because of the strength of those causes and conditions of good roots, I've now become a Buddha, a tathāgata, an arhat, or a samyak-saṃbuddha, and I've been able to turn the unsurpassed, most marvelous wheel of the Dharma.

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 我以福德智慧力故，現今所有一切剎利，及婆羅門、長者居士、沙門智人，信受我語，依我法行。
translation: By virtue of my merit and wisdom, I have made it possible for all the bhadras, priests, householders, and ascetics to accept my words with confidence and practice according to my teaching.

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 汝觀我語終無二言，如然燈佛授我決記，教示於我，我依修行，今得阿耨多羅三藐三菩提。」
translation: You observe that my words are never two, just as Rājñāta Buddha gave me a firm prediction and taught me, and I relied on his practice to attain unsurpassed, correct enlightenment today."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊而說偈言：「假使天落地，　　此大地變壞，　一切諸眾生，　　猶得常住身。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān spoke this verse, "Suppose the heavens fell to the ground and this great earth were to disintegrate, yet all sentient beings would still attain an eternally abiding body.

source_sentence: 須彌山王崩，　　大海水乾竭，　阿難汝當知，　　諸佛無二言。」
translation: When Mount Sumeru crumbles and the ocean dries up, you should know, Ānanda, that the buddhas don't say two things."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊說此偈已，復告阿難：「諸佛世尊，常有此行，假使光明無量無邊，為諸眾生，住持一尋；從是一尋，為諸眾生，復現無量無邊光明。
translation: After speaking this verse, the Bhagavān again addressed Ānanda, "The Bhagavān always has this practice of assuming that a limitless and infinite amount of light is maintained for sentient beings by a single discernment aspect, and from that single discernment, a limitless and infinite amount of light is again revealed for sentient beings.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 畏諸眾生不知晝夜，一月半月一年半年，春夏秋冬四時八節，恐其忘失。
translation: They're afraid that sentient beings won't know the day and night, or the months and a half of a month, the year and a half of a month, or the four seasons and eight periods of spring, summer, autumn, and winter, lest they forget them.

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 彼然燈佛十號具足，明照業成，常光無暗，是故彼佛，號曰然燈，常有光明照耀天下，自餘因緣，如上所說。
translation: That Rāntō Buddha is replete with the ten epithets, his karma is accomplished with insight and illumination, and he always shines without darkness; therefore, that Buddha is called Rāntō and always has light shining under the heavens for other reasons, as explained above.

source_sentence: 「阿難！
translation: "Ānanda!

source_sentence: 我念往昔，有一如來，出現於世，號勝一切多陀阿伽度、阿羅呵、三藐三佛陀，我以金華散彼佛上，發如是言：『願我未來，得微妙身，具足相法，如今世尊。』
translation: I remembered that in the past, there was a Tathāgata Yama who appeared in the world and was called the Tathāgata Aggata, Ārāha, and Samyak-saṃbuddha, and I scattered gold flowers over that Buddha and said, 'May I attain a marvelous body, complete with characteristics and teachings, in the future, now, world-honored.'

source_sentence: 爾時彼佛知於我心，即時微笑。
translation: Knowing my thoughts, the Buddha then immediately smiled.

source_sentence: 侍者比丘，整衣白佛，乃至佛告彼侍者言：『比丘！
translation: The attendant monk adjusted his robes and said to the Buddha, and the Buddha addressed the attendant, 'Monks!

source_sentence: 汝見是人將於金花散我上不？』
translation: Do you see this man scattering gold flowers over me?'

source_sentence: 時彼比丘答言：『我見。』
translation: The monk then replied, 'I see it.'

source_sentence: 佛告比丘：『是人過於一億劫後，當得作佛，號釋迦牟尼多陀阿伽度、阿羅呵、三藐三佛陀，十號具足。』
translation: The Buddha told the monk, 'After 100 million eons, this person will become a buddha and be called Śākyamuni, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Samyak-saṃbuddha, and the ten names are complete.'

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 我於彼時，得授記已，不捨精進勇猛之心，倍更增長，修餘福業。
translation: After I was given the prediction, I didn't abandon my zeal and boldness, but I doubled it and cultivated the rest of my meritorious actions.

source_sentence: 我以如是善因緣故，無量世中，生梵天上及於帝釋、轉輪聖王。
translation: Because of such good causes, I was born in an incalculably long time up in the Brahma Heaven, as well as in Indra and the Wheel-Turning Sage King.

source_sentence: 又作一王，名曰善見。
translation: I also became a king named Shangshui.

source_sentence: 彼王城墎却敵門樓，宮室殿堂，純是黃金，園苑樹林，泉流池沼，皆金挍飾。
translation: That king's city had an outer city wall that was surrounded by rival gates and palaces, and its palace halls were made entirely of gold, and its gardens, trees, forests, and springs and ponds were decorated with gold.

source_sentence: 彼業因緣，我今得成阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，轉於無上清淨法輪。
translation: As a result of their actions, I've now achieved supreme perfect enlightenment and turned the unsurpassed pure wheel of the Dharma.

source_sentence: 「阿難！
translation: "Ānanda!

source_sentence: 我念往昔，有一如來，出現於世，號蓮花上多陀阿伽度、阿羅呵、三藐三佛陀，我將銀華，散彼佛上，發如是願。
translation: I remember a time in the past when a Tathāgata appeared in the world named Padmôttara Agastya, Ārāhava, and Samyak-saṃbuddha, and I scattered silver flowers on top of that Buddha and made this vow.

source_sentence: 乃至彼佛告侍者言：『汝見是人將於銀花供養我不？』
translation: Even then, the Buddha told his attendant, 'Do you see this person offering silver flowers to me?'

source_sentence: 比丘言：『見。』
translation: The monks said, 'See.'

source_sentence: 佛告比丘：『是人未來過十萬劫，當得作佛，號釋迦牟尼多陀阿伽度、阿羅呵、三藐三佛陀。』
translation: The Buddha told the monk, 'In a hundred thousand eons, this person will become a buddha, and he'll be called Śākyamuni, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, and the Samyak-saṃbuddha.'

source_sentence: 我於彼時，聞授記已，不捨精進勇猛之心，倍更增長，作諸功德。
translation: At the time, after I heard about the prediction, I didn't abandon my zeal and vigor, but I doubled and increased my efforts to produce merits.

source_sentence: 我以如是善果報故，無量世中，作梵天王及於帝釋、轉輪聖王。
translation: As a result of such good rewards, I became the king of the Brahma gods, Indra, and the wheel-turning sage king for measureless lifetimes.

source_sentence: 又我過去，曾作一王，名大善見，所居之城，名拘尸那，彼城樓櫓，却敵窓牖，皆為白銀之所成就，園苑樹林，泉池諸水，悉是白銀，莊嚴挍飾，乃至彼業因緣報故，今得作佛、多陀阿伽度、阿羅呵、三藐三佛陀，乃至轉於無上法輪。
translation: In the past, I was once a king named Great Good Vision who lived in a city called Kuśinagara, whose towers and watchtowers were made of white silver, whose parks and groves and whose springs and pools were decorated with white silver, and whose causes and conditions made me the recipient of those actions, so that now I've become a buddha, a tathāgata, an arhat, a samyak-saṃbuddha, or a person who turns the unsurpassed wheel of the Dharma.

source_sentence: 「阿難！
translation: "Ānanda!

source_sentence: 往昔以來，有如是法，凡諸菩薩初生之時，東西南北各行七步，無人執持。
translation: In the past, there was such a thing as when bodhisattvas were first born, they took seven steps east, west, north, and south, and there was no one to hold them.

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 彼蓮花上佛初生時，兩足蹈地，其地處處皆生蓮花，面行七步，東西南北所踐之處，悉有蓮花，故號此佛為蓮花上。
translation: When he was first born, that Padmôttara Buddha touched the ground with both feet, lotus flowers grew everywhere on the ground, and he took seven steps facing each other, and there were lotus flowers everywhere he stepped, east, west, north, and south, so he called this Buddha Padmôttara.

source_sentence: 當於彼時，無量無邊百千萬眾，天、龍、夜叉、乾闥婆、阿脩羅、摩睺羅伽、人非人等，一時大唱，處處出聲，發如是言：『此大菩薩，名蓮華上。』
translation: At the time, measureless and limitless millions of people, gods, dragons, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, mahoragas, humans and non-humans, all sang out at once, making noises everywhere, saying, 'This great bodhisattva is called Padmôttara.'

source_sentence: 因於天人唱此聲故，彼佛世尊，號蓮花上。
translation: Because the gods and humans sang this sound, the Bhagavān was called 'Padmasaṃbhava' (Padmasaṃbhava).

source_sentence: 「阿難！
translation: "Ānanda!

source_sentence: 我念往昔，有一如來，出現於世，號最上行多陀阿伽度、阿羅呵、三藐三佛陀。
translation: I remembered that in the past, there was a Tathāgata Yogâcāra who appeared in the world and was called the supreme, practicing Agastya, Ārāha, and Samyak-saṃbuddha.

source_sentence: 爾時，我將一把金粟，散彼佛上，乃至彼佛語侍者言：『是人過於一千劫後，當得作佛，號釋迦牟尼。』
translation: At the time, I scattered a handful of gold corn on top of that Buddha, even as he told his attendant, 'After a thousand eons, this person will become a buddha and be called Śākyamuni.'

source_sentence: 我於彼時，聞授記已，不捨精進，增長善業。
translation: At the time, after I heard about the prediction, I didn't let go of my energy and increased my good actions.

source_sentence: 彼功德果報因緣故，無量世中，作梵釋天、轉輪聖王。
translation: As a result of the rewards of their merits, they became the Brahmakāyika gods and wheel-turning sage kings throughout measureless eons.

source_sentence: 又復曾作一轉輪王，名曰頂生。
translation: He also once became a wheel-turning king named Tiṅgārjuna.

source_sentence: 我於彼時，宮殿之內，經由七日，雨金粟雨，沒於人膝，縱廣彌滿。
translation: At the time, for seven days inside my palace, I rained down a rain of gold millet that fell to my knees, even though it was vast and full.

source_sentence: 以是善業因緣力故，我今得成阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，乃至轉於無上法輪。
translation: Because of the power of the causes and conditions of such good actions, I was able to achieve supreme perfect enlightenment and turn the unsurpassed wheel of the Dharma.

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 彼最上行如來，欲至聚落城邑乞食，足步虛空，去地六尺。
translation: That Tathāgata Supremely Active wanted to go to a village or town to solicit alms, so he stepped into the sky and went six feet to the ground.

source_sentence: 是時天、龍、人非人等，高聲唱言：『此佛世尊，名最上行。』
translation: The gods, dragons, humans, and nonhumans then raised their voices and said, 'This is the Bhagavān, who's called the Most Excellent Practitioner.'

source_sentence: 以是因緣，號是如來為最上行。
translation: Because of this reason, the Tathāgata is called the supreme practitioner.

source_sentence: 「阿難！
translation: "Ānanda!

source_sentence: 我念往昔，有一如來，出現於世，號上名稱多陀阿伽度、阿羅呵、三藐三佛陀。
translation: I remember a time in the past when there was a Tathāgata of the same lineage who appeared in the world and was called the supreme Tathāgata, the Aggata, the Arhat, and the Samyak-saṃbuddha.

source_sentence: 我時布施彼佛一室及比丘僧，而乞願言，乃至彼佛告侍者言：『是人於後滿五百劫，當得作佛，號釋迦牟尼。』
translation: I then gave alms to a room of that Buddha and his monks and begged them to vow, even as he told his attendant, 'That person will become a buddha called Śākyamuni 500 eons from now.'

source_sentence: 我於彼時，得授記已，不捨精進業因緣故，經無量世，作梵釋天、轉輪聖王。
translation: At the time, after I was granted assurance of Buddhahood and didn't abandon the causes and conditions of my exertion, I became the Brahmakāyika god or wheel-turning sage king through measureless eons.

source_sentence: 又是報故，我時作一轉輪聖王，名曰善見。
translation: As a result of this reward, I then became a wheel-turning sage king named Shanjian.

source_sentence: 時，天帝釋毘首羯磨，下來為我化作一殿，名一切勝。
translation: At the time, the god Śakra Vaiśukhara came down and made a palace for me called All Souls.

source_sentence: 以是善業果報因緣，我今得成阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，乃至轉於無上法輪。
translation: Because of the causes and conditions of the results of such good actions, I've now attained supreme perfect enlightenment and turned the unsurpassed wheel of the Dharma.

source_sentence: 「阿難！
translation: "Ānanda!

source_sentence: 我念往昔，有一如來，出現於世，號釋迦牟尼多陀阿伽度、阿羅呵、三藐三佛陀，與我同號，種姓父母，名字壽命，一切悉同我。
translation: I think back in the past, there was a Tathāgata who appeared in the world and was called Śākyamuni, Tathāgata, Ārāha, and Samyak-saṃbuddha, who shared my name, lineage, parents, and name and life span, all of which were the same as mine.

source_sentence: 將一掬蘇摩那華，散彼佛上(迦葉遺師說言，將金一掬)，發如是願，乃至彼佛語侍者言：『是人於後滿一百劫，當得作佛，號釋迦牟尼。』
translation: I scattered a handful of sumāna flowers on top of that Buddha (the Kāśyapa legate said, "Scatter a handful of gold") and made this vow, even as the Buddha said to his attendants, 'This person will become a buddha called Śākyamuni in the next 100 eons.'

source_sentence: 我於彼時，得受記已，不捨精進，增長功德，無量世中，作梵釋天、轉輪聖王。
translation: At the time, after I received that assurance, I didn't abandon my effort and increased my virtue, so that in measureless lifetimes I would become a Brahmakāyika god or a wheel-turning sage king.

source_sentence: 以是善業因緣力故，以三十七助菩提分法，莊嚴我身，令我得成阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，乃至轉於無上法輪。
translation: Because of the power of these causes and conditions of good actions, I adorned myself with thirty-seven factors of enlightenment that helped me achieve unsurpassed, correct enlightenment and turn the unsurpassed wheel of the Dharma.

source_sentence: 「阿難！
translation: "Ānanda!

source_sentence: 我念往昔，有一如來，出現於世，號曰帝沙多陀阿伽度、阿羅呵、三藐三佛陀。
translation: I think back in the past, there was a Tathāgata Yama who appeared in the world and was called Tissadatta Agastya, Ārāha, and Samyak-saṃbuddha.

source_sentence: 我將一掬碎末栴檀，散彼佛上，乃至彼佛告侍者言：『是人過於九十五劫，當得作佛，號釋迦牟尼。』
translation: I scattered a handful of powdered sandalwood on top of that Buddha, even as he told his attendant, 'After 95 eons, this person will become a buddha and be called Śākyamuni.'

source_sentence: 「我於彼時，得授記已，不捨精進，增長功德，無量世中，作梵釋天、轉輪聖王。
translation: "At the time, after I was granted assurance of Buddhahood, I didn't abandon my effort and increased my virtue, so that in measureless lifetimes I would become a Brahmakāyika god or a wheel-turning sage king.

source_sentence: 以是善業因緣力故，我得名為最上戒行清淨具足；以是善業果報因緣，我得名為最上智見功德具足(迦葉遺師如是說言，我以善業因緣力故，得於最上戒行功德，名稱遠聞，乃至得於最上智見，功德遠聞)，我今得成阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，乃至轉於無上法輪。
translation: Because of the power of the causes and conditions of such good actions, I was given the name Most Excellent Perfection of Moral Conduct and Purity, and because of the causes and conditions of the results of such good actions, I was given the name Most Excellent Perfection of Wisdom and Vision. (Thus did Kāśyapa's teacher say, "Because of the power of the causes and conditions of good actions, I've attained the most excellent merit of moral conduct, a name that's far-reaching, and I've attained the most excellent wisdom and vision, a merit that's far-reaching.) Now, I've attained supreme perfect enlightenment and turned the unsurpassed wheel of the Dharma.

source_sentence: 「阿難！
translation: "Ānanda!

source_sentence: 我念往昔，有一如來，出現於世，號曰弗沙多陀阿伽度、阿羅呵、三藐三佛陀。
translation: I think back in the past, there was a Tathāgata Yama who appeared in the world and was called Pūrṣadatta Agastya, Ārāha, and Samyak-saṃbuddha.

source_sentence: 時彼佛在雜寶窟內，我見彼佛，心生歡喜，合十指掌，翹於一脚，七日七夜，而將此偈讚歎彼佛，而說偈言：「『天上天下無如佛，　　十方世界亦無比，　　世間所有我盡見，　　一切無有如佛者。』
translation: When I saw that Buddha inside the cave of mixed treasures, my heart rejoiced, and I joined my palms with my ten fingers and bowed my feet for seven days and nights, praising that Buddha with this verse and saying, 'There's no Buddha like him in heaven or on earth, nor is there anything like him in the world in the ten directions, nor have I seen all of the world's possessions, but there's nothing like the Buddha.'

source_sentence: 「阿難！
translation: "Ānanda!

source_sentence: 我以此偈歎彼佛已，發如是願，乃至彼佛語侍者言：『是人過於九十四劫，當得作佛，號釋迦牟尼。』
translation: After I praised that Buddha in this verse, I made this vow, even as he said to his attendant, 'After 94 eons, this person will become a buddha and be called Śākyamuni.'

source_sentence: 我於彼時，得授記已，不捨精進，增長功德，無量世中，作梵釋天、轉輪聖王。
translation: At the time, after I was granted assurance of Buddhahood, I didn't abandon my effort and increased my virtue, so that in measureless lifetimes I would become a Brahmakāyika god or a wheel-turning sage king.

source_sentence: 以是善業因緣力故，我得四種辯才具足，無有一人能共我論降伏我者，我得成於阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，乃至轉於無上法輪。
translation: Because of the power of the causes and conditions of such good actions, I've attained the four abilities of eloquence, and there's no one who can subdue me with their arguments, so I'll achieve supreme perfect enlightenment and turn the unsurpassed wheel of the Dharma.

source_sentence: 「阿難！
translation: "Ānanda!

source_sentence: 我念往昔，有一如來，出現於世，號見真理多陀阿伽度、阿羅呵、三藐三佛陀。
translation: I remembered that in the past, there was a Tathāgata who appeared in the world and was called the Tathāgata, Ārāha, and Samyak-saṃbuddha who saw the truth.

source_sentence: 我於爾時，將種種花，散彼佛上(迦葉遺師說言，彼佛號曰見一切理)，乃至彼佛語侍者言：『是人過於九十三劫，當得作佛，號釋迦牟尼。』
translation: At the time, I scattered various flowers on top of that Buddha (Kāśyapa's mentor said that the Buddha's name was Seeing All Truths), even as he told his attendants, 'After 93 eons, this person will become a buddha and be called Śākyamuni.'

source_sentence: 我於彼時，得授記已，不捨精進，增長功德，無量世中，作梵釋天、轉輪聖王。
translation: At the time, after I was granted assurance of Buddhahood, I didn't abandon my effort and increased my virtue, becoming a Brahmakāyika god or a wheel-turning sage king in an immeasurable number of eons.

source_sentence: 以是因緣，我今獲得最上之名具持戒行，乃至得名解脫知見一切具足，證於阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，乃至轉於無上法輪。
translation: Because of these causes, I've now attained the highest reputation for upholding precepts and practices, up to attaining the full completion of knowledge and vision of liberation, realizing unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, and turning the unsurpassed wheel of the Dharma.

source_sentence: 「阿難！
translation: "Ānanda!

source_sentence: 我念往昔，有一如來，出現於世，號毗婆尸多陀阿伽度、阿羅呵、三藐三佛陀。
translation: I think back in the past, there was a Tathāgata Yama who appeared in the world and was called Vipaśyinta Agastya, Ārāha, and Samyak-saṃbuddha.

source_sentence: 我於爾時，將一掬小豆，散彼佛上，乃至彼佛告侍者言：『是人過於九十一劫，當得作佛，號釋迦牟尼，十號具足。』
translation: At the time, I scattered a handful of lentils on top of that Buddha, even as he told his attendant, 'After 91 eons, this person will become a buddha and be called Śākyamuni, and his 10 epithets will be complete.'

source_sentence: 我於彼時，得授記已，不捨精進，增長功德，無量世中，作梵釋天、轉輪聖王。
translation: At the time, after I was granted assurance of Buddhahood, I didn't abandon my effort and increased my virtue, so that in measureless lifetimes I would become a Brahmakāyika god or a wheel-turning sage king.

source_sentence: 以是善業因緣力故，我又曾作一轉輪王，名為頂生，得四天下，復得帝釋半座而坐。
translation: Because of the power of the causes and conditions of such good actions, I was once a wheel-turning king named Tiṣya, who attained four worlds and was again given half of the seat of Indra.

source_sentence: 以是果報，今得成於阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，乃至轉於無上法輪。
translation: As a result, I now attain supreme perfect enlightenment and turn the unsurpassed wheel of the Dharma.

source_sentence: 「阿難！
translation: "Ānanda!

source_sentence: 我念往昔，有一如來，出現於世，號曰尸棄多陀阿伽度、阿羅呵、三藐三佛陀。
translation: I think back in the past, there was a Tathāgata who appeared in the world and was called Śṛgata Agastya, Ālāha, and Samyak-saṃbuddha.

source_sentence: 我於彼時，將無價衣，覆彼佛上及聲聞眾，發如是願，乃至彼佛告侍者言：『是人過於三十一劫，當得作佛號釋迦牟尼。』
translation: At the time, I covered that Buddha and the śrāvakas with priceless robes and made this vow, even as the Buddha told his attendant, 'After 31 eons, this person will become a buddha named Śākyamuni.'

source_sentence: 我於彼時，得授記已，不捨精進勇猛之心，常行布施，造作福業。
translation: At the time, after I was granted assurance of Buddhahood, I didn't abandon my zeal and vigor, and I always made alms and created good deeds.

source_sentence: 我以如是善業因緣，無量世中，作大梵王及天帝釋、轉輪聖王，今日復得種種衣服，所謂迦尸迦衣、芻摩妙衣、劫波妙衣、憍奢耶衣、拘沈婆衣，我今得成阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，乃至轉於無上法輪。
translation: As a result of such good actions, I became the king of the Brahmas, the gods, and the wheel-turning sage kings for measureless eons, and today I've attained various kinds of clothing, such as the kāśyapa robe, the kumāra robe, the kapāra robe, the kauśeya robe, and the kuśumbara robe, and I've now achieved supreme perfect enlightenment and turned the unsurpassed wheel of the Dharma.

source_sentence: 「阿難！
translation: "Ānanda!

source_sentence: 我念往昔，有一如來，出現於世，號毘舍浮多陀阿伽度、阿羅呵、三藐三佛陀。
translation: I remember a time in the past when there was a Tathāgata called Viśvabuddha, Agastya, Arhat, and Samyak-saṃbuddha who appeared in the world.

source_sentence: 我於爾時，將好種種百味飲食，布施彼佛及聲聞眾，發如是願，乃至彼佛告侍者言：『是人過於三十劫後，當得作佛，號釋迦牟尼。』
translation: At the time, I gave that Buddha and the śrāvakas a good meal of a hundred flavors and made this vow, even as he told his attendant, 'After 30 eons, this person will become a buddha and be called Śākyamuni.'

source_sentence: 我於彼時，得授記已，不捨精進勇猛之心，常行布施，造作福業。
translation: At the time, after I was granted assurance of Buddhahood, I didn't abandon my zealous and courageous attitude, and I always made alms and created meritorious actions.

source_sentence: 我以如是善根因緣，無量世中，作大梵王，或作帝釋、轉輪聖王，今得種種百味飲食，乃至得成阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，轉於無上清淨法輪。
translation: Because of such good roots and causes, I've been made a great Brahma king, or an emperor, or a wheel-turning sage king for measureless eons, and now I've been given a hundred flavors of food and drink, and I've attained unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment and turned the unsurpassed, pure wheel of the Dharma.

source_sentence: 「阿難！
translation: "Ānanda!

source_sentence: 我念往昔，於拘婁孫多陀阿伽度、阿羅呵、三藐三佛陀邊，行於梵行，求未來世阿耨多羅三藐三菩提故。
translation: I'm mindful that in the past, I practiced the religious practice beside Kaurosundra Agastya, Ālāha, and Samyak-saṃbuddha, seeking the unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment of future generations.

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 我念往昔，於迦那迦牟尼多陀阿伽度、阿羅呵、三藐三佛陀邊，行於梵行，求未來世阿耨多羅三藐三菩提故。
translation: I'm mindful that in the past, I practiced the religious practice beside Kanakamuni, Tathāgata, Ārāha, and Samyak-saṃbuddha, seeking the unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment of future generations.

source_sentence: 「阿難！
translation: "Ānanda!

source_sentence: 我念往昔，於迦葉多陀阿伽度、阿羅呵、三藐三佛陀邊，行於梵行，求未來世阿耨多羅三藐三菩提故。
translation: I'm mindful that in the past, I practiced the religious practice beside Kāśyapa Tathāgata, Ārāha, and Samyak-saṃbuddha, seeking the unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment of future generations.

source_sentence: 「阿難！
translation: "Ānanda!

source_sentence: 我念往昔，於彌勒菩薩邊，齎持種種微妙四事供養之具，供養恭敬，尊重讚歎，自恣奉獻，求未來世阿耨多羅三藐三菩提故。
translation: I'm mindful that in the past, I carried around the Maitreya Bodhisattva a variety of subtle, four-item offerings, made offerings, respected and praised them, and freely offered them up in order to pursue the unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment of future generations.

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 我念往昔，將無量種供養之具，所至到處，即持供養過去無量諸佛菩薩及聲聞眾，種諸善根，求未來世阿耨多羅三藐三菩提故。
translation: I'm mindful that in the past, I made measureless offerings to measureless Buddhas, Bodhisattvas, and śrāvakas in the past, planting good roots and seeking the unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment of future generations wherever I went.

source_sentence: 「阿難！
translation: "Ānanda!

source_sentence: 往昔過百阿僧祇劫，是時有佛，出現於世，號曰然燈多陀阿伽度、阿羅呵、三藐三佛陀。
translation: Once upon a time, more than a hundred incalculable eons ago, there was a Buddha who appeared in the world and was called Randhammata Agastya, Āraha, and Samyak-saṃbuddha.

source_sentence: 「阿難！
translation: "Ānanda!

source_sentence: 如是次第，過百億劫時，有一佛出現於世，號一切勝多陀阿伽度、阿羅呵、三藐三佛陀。
translation: In this order, after 10 billion eons, there appeared in the world a Buddha who was called Prabhūtaratna, Ārāha, and Samyak-saṃbuddha.

source_sentence: 「阿難！
translation: "Ānanda!

source_sentence: 如是次第，過五百劫時，有一佛出現於世，號最上名稱多陀阿伽度、阿羅呵、三藐三佛陀。
translation: In this order, after 500 eons, a Buddha appeared in the world who was called the most excellent name, Tathāgata, Arhat, and Samyak-saṃbuddha.

source_sentence: 「阿難！
translation: "Ānanda!

source_sentence: 如是次第，過一百劫時，有一佛出現於世，號釋迦牟尼多陀阿伽度、阿羅呵、三藐三佛陀。
translation: In this order, after a hundred eons, there appeared in the world a Buddha named Śākyamuni, Tathāgata, Ālāha, and Samantabhadra.

source_sentence: 「阿難！
translation: "Ānanda!

source_sentence: 如是次第，九十四劫時，有一佛出現於世，號曰弗沙多陀阿伽度、阿羅呵、三藐三佛陀。
translation: In this order, during 94 eons, there appeared in the world a Buddha named Puṣyadarśana, Ālāha, and Samyak-saṃbuddha.

source_sentence: 「阿難！
translation: "Ānanda!

source_sentence: 如是次第，九十三劫時，有一佛出現於世，號曰見義多陀阿伽度、阿羅呵、三藐三佛陀。
translation: In this order, during 93 eons, there appeared in the world a Buddha named Megha-datta Agastya, Ārāha, and Samyak-saṃbuddha.

source_sentence: 「阿難！
translation: "Ānanda!

source_sentence: 如是次第，九十一劫時，有一佛出現於世，號毘婆尸多陀阿伽度、阿羅呵、三藐三佛陀。
translation: In this order, during the 91st eon, there appeared in the world a Buddha named Vipaśyinta Agastya, Ālāha, and Samantabhadra.

source_sentence: 「阿難！
translation: "Ānanda!

source_sentence: 如是次第，三十一劫時，有一佛出現於世，號曰尸棄多陀阿伽度、阿羅呵、三藐三佛陀。
translation: In this order, during the thirty-one eons, there appeared in the world a Buddha named Śikhin Tathāgata Agastya, Ārāha, and Samyak-saṃbuddha.

source_sentence: 同是劫中，又有一佛，復出於世，號曰神聞多陀阿伽度、阿羅呵、三藐三佛陀。
translation: In the same eon, another Buddha, called Shenwendotuo Agastya, Arhat, and Samyak-saṃbuddha, appeared in the world again.

source_sentence: 「阿難！
translation: "Ānanda!

source_sentence: 此賢劫初，第一拘婁孫馱如來，出現於世。
translation: At the beginning of this good eon, the first Kaurosundra Tathāgata appeared in the world.

source_sentence: 「第二拘那含牟尼如來，出現於世。
translation: "The second Tathāgata Kanakamuni appeared in the world.

source_sentence: 第三迦葉如來，出現於世。
translation: The third, the Tathāgata Kāśyapa, appeared in the world.

source_sentence: 「第四我身釋迦牟尼如來，今現在世。
translation: "The fourth self, Śākyamuni, Tathāgata, now appears in the world.

source_sentence: 「阿難！
translation: "Ānanda!

source_sentence: 彼然燈多陀阿伽度、阿羅呵、三藐三佛陀，出現於世，生大婆羅門家。
translation: That Rājagṛha, Agastya, Arhat, and Samyak-saṃbuddha appeared in the world and was born to a great family of brāhmaṇas.

source_sentence: 「一切勝佛，出現於世，生大剎利王家。
translation: "Sarvâstivāda Buddha appeared in the world and was born to a great family of the Śāriputra kings.

source_sentence: 「蓮華上佛，出現於世，生大婆羅門家。
translation: "The Padmôttara Buddha appears in the world and is born to a great family of brāhmaṇas.

source_sentence: 「最上行佛，出現於世，生大剎利王家。
translation: "The paramount practice Buddha appears in the world and is born to the great house of King Sālêndra.

source_sentence: 「德上名稱佛，出現於世，生大婆羅門家。
translation: "The Buddha of Superlative Names appeared in the world and was born to a great Brāhmaṇa family.

source_sentence: 「釋迦牟尼佛，出現於世，生大剎利王家。
translation: "Śākyamuni Buddha, who appeared in the world, was born to a great family of Śāriputra kings.

source_sentence: 「帝沙如來，出現於世，生大婆羅門家。
translation: "Tissa Tathāgata appeared in the world and was born to a great family of brāhmaṇas.

source_sentence: 「弗沙如來，出現於世，生大剎利王家。
translation: "Pūrṣa the Tathāgata appeared in the world and was born to a great family of Śāriputra kings.

source_sentence: 「見真義佛，出現於世，生大婆羅門家。
translation: "The Buddha of True Meaning appeared in the world and was born to a great family of brāhmaṇas.

source_sentence: 「毘婆尸佛，出現於世，生大剎利王家。
translation: "Vipaśyin Buddha appeared in the world and was born to a great family of the Śāriputra kings.

source_sentence: 「尸棄如來，出現於世，生大剎利王家。
translation: "Śikhin Tathāgata appeared in the world and was born to a great family of the Śāriputra kings.

source_sentence: 「神聞如來，出現於世，生大剎利王家。
translation: "The Tathāgata Śrīmālā appeared in the world and was born to the family of King Mahākāli.

source_sentence: 「拘婁孫馱佛，出現於世，生大婆羅門家。
translation: "The Krakucchanda Buddha appeared in the world and was born into the household of a great Brāhmaṇa.

source_sentence: 「拘那含牟尼佛，出現於世，生大婆羅門家。
translation: "Kanakamuni Buddha appeared in the world and was born to a great Brāhmaṇa family.

source_sentence: 「迦葉如來，出現於世，生大婆羅門家。
translation: "Kāśyapa Tathāgata appeared in the world and was born into a great Brāhmaṇa family.

source_sentence: 「阿難！
translation: "Ānanda!

source_sentence: 我今在於剎利種姓大王家生，出現世間。
translation: Now, I was born in the household of a great king of the Sālêndra family and appeared in the world.

source_sentence: 「阿難！
translation: "Ānanda!

source_sentence: 然燈佛多陀阿伽度、阿羅呵、三藐三佛陀，壽命八百四千萬億歲，住世利益諸世間故(尼沙塞師如是說。
translation: "Rājñāta Tathāgata, the arhat, and samyak-saṃbuddha, has a lifespan of 8,400,000,000,000 years, and he lives in the world to benefit the world (so said Master Nisanzai.

source_sentence: 迦葉遺師復言，然燈如來壽命一劫住世，及聲聞眾利益諸世間故)。
translation: Kāśyapa's mentor also said, "The life of Rājñāta Tathāgata is one eon, and it's because the śrāvakas benefit the world.")

source_sentence: 「阿難！
translation: "Ānanda!

source_sentence: 一切勝如來，住世八萬億歲，利益一切諸世間故(尼沙塞師如是說。
translation: "The Tathāgata Supremacy abides for eight trillion years to benefit all the world. (Thus did Nityaparinirvṛta say.

source_sentence: 迦葉遺師復言，一切勝如來住世一劫，利益世間故)。
translation: Kāśyapa's mentor also said, "The Tathāgata par excellence abides in the world for an eon for the benefit of the world.")

source_sentence: 「蓮華上佛，住世八萬歲，為利益故。
translation: "The Padmôttara Buddha lives in the world for 80,000 years for the benefit of the world.

source_sentence: 「最上行佛，住世八萬歲，為利益故。
translation: "The paramount practice Buddha abides in the world for 80,000 years for the benefit of the world.

source_sentence: 「上名稱佛，住世六萬歲，為利益故。
translation: "The Buddha best known as the Praiseworthy One abides in the world for 60,000 years for the sake of his benefits.

source_sentence: 「釋迦牟尼佛，住世八萬歲，為利益故。
translation: "Śākyamuni Buddha, who lives in the world for 80,000 years, does so for the benefit of others.

source_sentence: 「帝沙如來，住世六萬歲，為利益故。
translation: "Tissa Tathāgata, who remains in the world for 60,000 years, does so for the benefit of others.

source_sentence: 「弗沙如來，住世五萬歲，為利益故。
translation: "Pūrṣa Tathāgata, who remains in the world for 50,000 years, does so for the benefit of others.

source_sentence: 「見真義佛，住世四萬歲，為利益故。
translation: "The Buddha of True Meaning abides in the world for 40,000 years for the sake of his welfare.

source_sentence: 「毘婆尸佛，住世八萬歲，為利益故。
translation: "Vipaśyin Buddha, who remains in the world for 80,000 years, does so for the benefit of others.

source_sentence: 「神聞如來，住世六萬歲，為利益故。
translation: "The God-worshipping Tathāgata abides in the world for 60,000 years for the sake of his welfare.

source_sentence: 「拘婁孫馱佛，住世四萬歲，為利益故。
translation: "The Krakucchanda Buddha lives in the world for 40,000 years for the sake of his welfare.

source_sentence: 「拘那含牟尼佛，住世三萬歲，為利益故。
translation: "Kanakamuni Buddha, who lives in the world for 30,000 years, does so for the benefit of others.

source_sentence: 「迦葉如來，住世二萬歲，為利益故。
translation: "Kāśyapa Tathāgata lives in the world for 20,000 years for the sake of his welfare.

source_sentence: 「阿難！
translation: "Ānanda!

source_sentence: 我今多陀阿伽度、阿羅呵、三藐三佛陀，住世八十歲，為利益故。
translation: Now, I, Tathāgata Agastya, Ārāha, and Samyak-saṃbuddha, have stayed in the world for 80 years for the sake of his welfare.

source_sentence: 而說偈言：「『有佛以神通，　　住世受供養，　　或神通及業，　　盡已入涅槃。』
translation: He spoke this verse, saying, 'A Buddha with supernormal powers lives in the world and is offered offerings, or he enters nirvāṇa completely after possessing supernormal powers and actions.'

source_sentence: 「阿難！
translation: "Ānanda!

source_sentence: 然燈如來，有於二百五十萬億聲聞弟子大眾集會，如來滅後，法住於世，經七萬歲。
translation: "Still, the Tathāgata had a great assembly of 250,000,000,000 śrāvaka disciples, and after the Tathāgata's death, the Dharma remained in the world for 70,000 years.

source_sentence: 末後十年，諸比丘等，不生敬信，無慚愧心，營理世務，樂於諸業，所有持疑，不相諮問，各恃己能，互生憍慢，恒聚非法。
translation: For the last ten years, those monks didn't have respect or faith, didn't have a sense of shame, conducted worldly affairs, enjoyed their activities, didn't consult each other about their doubts, relied on their own abilities, became proud of each other, and constantly gathered unlawfulness.

source_sentence: 諸惡知識不善之人，以為朋友，共相狎習，圍繞遊從。
translation: Those with bad friends and unwholesome associates take them as friends, share their sexual habits, and surround themselves with them.

source_sentence: 是等癡人，行不純故，使彼如來佛法僧寶，速疾隱沒不現世間，所有經書，悉皆滅盡。
translation: Such foolish people and their impure ways cause the Tathāgatas, the treasures of buddhas, Dharma, and saṃgha to quickly disappear from the world, and all their sūtras to be extinguished.

source_sentence: 「一切勝佛，有萬四千聲聞弟子大眾集會，如來滅後，正法住世，經於少時。
translation: "There are 4,000 śrāvaka disciples who assemble in great multitudes at the All Souls' Buddha, and the right teaching remains in the world for a short time after the Tathāgata's death.

source_sentence: 「蓮華上佛，有七萬眾聲聞集會，如來滅後，正法住世，經十萬歲。
translation: "The Padmasaṃbhava Buddha has 70,000 śrāvakas assembled, and after the Tathāgata's cessation, the right teaching remains in the world for 100,000 years.

source_sentence: 「上行如來，有六萬眾聲聞集會，如來滅後，正法住世，七萬七千歲。
translation: "The Upāyaśaila Tathāgata has 60,000 śrāvakas assembled, and after the Tathāgata's cessation, the right Dharma abides in the world for 77,000 years.

source_sentence: 「德上名稱佛，有二萬眾聲聞集會，如來滅後，正法住世，經五百歲。
translation: "The best-named Buddha has 20,000 śrāvakas assembled, and after the Tathāgata's cessation, the right teaching remains in the world for 500 years.

source_sentence: 「釋迦牟尼佛，有於一千二百五十聲聞集會，如來滅後，正法住世，經五百歲，像法住世，亦五百歲。
translation: "Śākyamuni Buddha had an assembly of 1,250 śrāvakas who, after the Tathāgata's cessation, had the true teaching abide in the world for 500 years and an image teaching abide in the world for another 500 years.

source_sentence: 「帝沙如來，有六萬億聲聞集會，如來滅後，正法住世，經二萬歲。
translation: "Tissa the Tathāgata had an assembly of six thousand million śrāvakas who, after the Tathāgata's cessation, had the true teaching abide in the world for 20,000 years.

source_sentence: 「弗沙如來，有無量億聲聞集會，如來滅後，正法像法，乃至法住，乃至法滅。
translation: "Tathāgata Puṣya has measureless millions of śrāvakas who assemble, and after the Tathāgata's cessation, the right Dharma and the like Dharma continue to abide until the Dharma ceases.

source_sentence: 「見一切義佛，有三十二億那由他眾聲聞集會，如來滅後，正法暫時，不久住世。
translation: "The Seen-All-Means Buddha has 3.2 billion nayutas of śrāvakas assembled, and after the Tathāgata ceases, the right teaching is temporary and will soon reside in the world.

source_sentence: 「毘婆尸佛，三會說法，度聲聞眾：第一大會，一百六十八百千人；第二大會，有十萬人；第三大會，八百千人。
translation: "Vipaśyin Buddha preaches at three assemblies and liberates crowds of śrāvakas: the first assembly of 16,800,000 people, the second assembly of 100,000 people, and the third assembly of 800,000 people.

source_sentence: 如來滅後，正法住世，經二萬歲。
translation: After the Tathāgata's death, the right teaching remained in the world for 20,000 years.

source_sentence: 「神聞如來，唯有二會，度聲聞眾：第一會度有七萬人，第二會度有六萬人。
translation: "The gods heard that the Tathāgata had only two assemblies to save the śrāvaka community: the first assembly saved 70,000 people, and the second assembly saved 60,000 people.

source_sentence: 如來滅後，正法住世，經六萬歲。
translation: After the Tathāgata's death, the true teaching remained in the world for 60,000 years.

source_sentence: 「拘婁孫馱佛，有四萬眾聲聞弟子，如來滅後，正法住世，經五百歲。
translation: "The Kauśāmbī-Kauṇḍinya Buddha had 40,000 śrāvaka disciples, and after the Tathāgata's death, the true teaching remained in the world for 500 years.

source_sentence: 「拘那含牟尼佛，有三百萬聲聞集會，如來滅後，正法住世二十九日。
translation: "Kanakamuni Buddha had an assembly of 3 million śrāvakas, and after the Tathāgata ceased, the true teaching remained in the world for 29 days.

source_sentence: 「迦葉如來，有二萬眾聲聞集會，如來滅後，正法住世，經於七日。
translation: "Kāśyapa Tathāgata had 20,000 śrāvakas assemble, and after the Tathāgata ceased, the true teaching remained in the world for seven days.

source_sentence: 「阿難！
translation: "Ānanda!

source_sentence: 我多陀阿伽度、阿羅呵、三藐三佛陀，有一千二百五十聲聞集會，我滅度後，正法住世，有五百歲，像法住世，亦五百歲。
translation: I, Tathāgata Agastya, Ārāha, and Samantabhadra, had an assembly of 1,250 śrāvakas, and after my extinction, the right teaching lived on for 500 years, and the conventional teaching lived on for 500 years.

source_sentence: 今當略說優陀那偈，而說偈言：「『說施及年數，　　種姓并壽命，　　聲聞眾集會，　　正法與像法。
translation: Now, you will briefly expound the verse of Udayana and say the verse, 'They say generosity and years, family and life span, assembly of śrāvakas, and the right teaching and the image teaching.'

source_sentence: 彼等諸世尊，　　住世般涅槃，　　釋種大師子，　　總說悉已訖。』」
translation: Those world-honored ones who live in parinirvāṇa, the great son of the Śākya lineage, have all completed their general explanation.'"

source_sentence: 佛本行集經賢劫王種品第三上
translation: Sutra of the Collection of the Past Activities of the Buddha, the Third and Foremost Chapter of the Seeds of the Bhadraśri Kiṃśa

source_sentence: 爾時，佛在王舍大城竹林精舍迦蘭陀鳥所居之處，與大比丘五百人俱。
translation: At the time, the Buddha was staying at the Kalandaka Bird's residence in the Bamboo Grove Monastery of Rājagṛha with a large group of 500 monks.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊依諸佛法，乃至說於清淨梵行，告諸比丘：「汝諸比丘！
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān addressed the monks, relying on the Buddha's teachings, even as he taught the pure religious practice, "You monks!

source_sentence: 諦聽諦受！
translation: Hear and accept it!

source_sentence: 如世尊教。」
translation: As the Bhagavān taught."

source_sentence: 諸比丘言：「我等歡喜信心奉持。」
translation: The monks said, "We rejoice and faithfully adhere to it."

source_sentence: 佛告比丘：「此賢劫初，地建立已，有一最尊豪勝富貴大首領人轉輪王種，名眾集置。
translation: The Buddha told the monks, "At the beginning of this good eon, after the earth was established, there was a most honored, wealthy, powerful, and great chieftain of people who turned into a wheel-turning king of sorts named Mass Gathering.

source_sentence: 既安置已，時諸大眾白地主言：『我大地主，當為我等，治罰惡人，賞於良善。
translation: After they had been installed, the people said to the landowner, 'My great landowner will punish the bad and reward the good for us.

source_sentence: 仁者當分稻田與我，我各種之；我等種已，當各割分，奉輸仁者。』
translation: You, sir, will share your rice fields with me, and I will plant them; after we plant them, we'll each cut a share and give it to you, sir.'

source_sentence: 時彼地主，受大眾請，即為如法依平撿挍，惡者治罰，善者賞之。
translation: The landowner then was invited by the people and did a level inspection according to the teaching, punishing the bad and rewarding the good.

source_sentence: 人得稻田，各加守護，佃熟已後，隨分受之。」
translation: Each person who has obtained a rice field will guard it, and after it's ripened, he'll take a share of it."

source_sentence: 佛告比丘：「時彼大眾，如是集會和合，共推扶彼仁者，持為地主，以為大眾商量舉故，故號彼為大眾平章。
translation: The Buddha told the monks, "The masses thus assembled and united together elected that kind man to be the landowner, and because he held up the land for the masses to discuss, they called him the Vairocana Vipaśyinta.

source_sentence: 又彼地主，為諸大眾如法治化，令眾歡喜同心愛樂，得共和合，各各處分，故名為王。
translation: That lord of the land disciplines the masses according to the rules, causing them to rejoice, be united in love and happiness, and attain unity in their respective parts, which is why he's called the king.

source_sentence: 又復守護一切稻田，熟取眾人，稻田分故，名剎利王。
translation: He also guards all the rice fields, taking all the people's ripened rice and dividing it among them, and is therefore called the king of the bharifs.

source_sentence: 剎利王者，名為田主。
translation: That man, King Bāli, is called the lord of the rice fields.

source_sentence: 汝等當知！
translation: All of you should know this!

source_sentence: 以是因緣，劫最初時，大眾所立王種是也。」
translation: For this reason, at the beginning of the eon, this was the type of king that the great multitude had created."

source_sentence: 佛告比丘：「時彼大眾所立之王，後生一子，名曰真實，為轉輪王，王四天下，作大地主，七寶自然，千子具足，備三十二大丈夫相，威德勇猛，能摧怨賊。
translation: The Buddha told the monks, "The king that was then established by the masses gave birth to a son named Truthful, who became a wheel-turning king, ruled the four worlds, was a great lord of the earth, was endowed with seven treasures, had a thousand sons, was equipped with thirty-two great characteristics, was dignified and courageous, and was able to crush enemies and thieves.

source_sentence: 彼王治化，在世之時，大地及海，無有荊棘丘陵高下，五穀豐熟，人民安樂，無諸恐怖及以艱難，不用兵戈，諸方自伏，如法治化。
translation: When that king rules and educates the world, the earth and sea are devoid of thorns and hills, the grains are abundant, the people are happy, there are no fears or difficulties, and there's no need for armies or weapons to subdue various directions, so he rules and educates them.

source_sentence: 「諸比丘！
translation: "Monks!

source_sentence: 彼真實王，千子之內，有一長子，名曰意喜，亦名自用，此子亦作轉輪聖王，如上所說，七寶千子，乃至大地，如法治化。
translation: "That true king, among his thousand sons, is an eldest son named Wishful Thinking, also known as Self-use, who also serves as a wheel-turning sage king as described above, and who is endowed with a thousand sons of the seven jewels, even down to the earth, according to the rules for teaching.

source_sentence: 「諸比丘！
translation: "Monks!

source_sentence: 彼自用王，千子之內，有一長子，名曰智者，眾人號之，名為受戒。
translation: "That self-made king, among his thousand sons, had an eldest son named Wise One, whom the people called 'Received Precepts.'

source_sentence: 彼智者王，亦紹父位，作轉輪王，如上所說，七寶千子，乃至大地，如法治化。
translation: That king, the Wise One, also assumed his father's position and became a wheel-turning king, as described above, with a thousand sons of seven treasures, even down to the earth, which he disciplined according to the rules.

source_sentence: 「諸比丘！
translation: "Monks!

source_sentence: 彼智者王，千子之內，最初長子，名曰頂生，亦紹父位，作轉輪王，如上所說，乃至大地，如法治化。
translation: That king of wise men, the firstborn of a thousand sons named Tiṅgāyana, also assumed his father's position and became a wheel-turning king as described above, even down to the earth, which is transformed according to the rules.

source_sentence: 「諸比丘！
translation: "Monks!

source_sentence: 彼頂生王，千子之內，最初長子，名為大海，亦紹父位，作轉輪王，如上所說。
translation: That paramount king, the firstborn among a thousand sons, whose name is Mahāsa, also assumed the position of father and became a wheel-turning king, as explained above.

source_sentence: 諸比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 彼大海王，千子之內，最初長子，名為具足，眾人又喚，名之為敷，次紹王位，如上所說。
translation: "That great ocean king, the firstborn of a thousand sons, was called Completely, and was called by many people to be perfumed, and then he assumed the position of king as explained above.

source_sentence: 「諸比丘！
translation: "Monks!

source_sentence: 彼具足王，千子之內，最初長子，名為養育，次紹王位，如上所說。
translation: "That fully endowed king, among his thousand sons, has the firstborn son, who's called Nourishing, and then he introduces the king's position, as explained above.

source_sentence: 「諸比丘！

source_sentence: 彼養育王，千子之內，最初長子，名曰福車，次紹王位，如上所說。
